description: Application for a minor material amendment (S73) variation/removal of condition nos.8 (change from NOx boiler emissions to Air Source Heat Pumps (ASHP) unitsheat pump); no.12 (CO2 emissions); no.13 (sustainability report compliance) - pursuant to planning permission ref.182145FUL dated 12/10/2018 for 'Construction of nine two-storey terraced houses (following demolition of lock up garages) with associated car parking and amenity space'
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of the original permission (182145FUL).
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: 1634-01 Version 11c, 1634-02 Version 11c, 1634-03 Version 11c, 1634-04 Version 11c, 1634-05 Version 11c, 1634-06 Version 11c, 1634-07 Version 11c,1634-08 Version 11c, 1634-10 A Version 11c, 1634-11 Version 11c, 1634-12 Version 11c, 1634-13 A Version 11c, 1634-14 Version 11c, 1634-15 Version 11c, 1634-16 Version 11c, 1634-17 Version 11c, 1634-18 Version 11c, 1634-19 Version 11c, 1634-20 Version 11c, 1634-21 Version 11c, 1634-22 Version 11c, 1634-23 Version 11c, 1634-24 Version 11c, 1634-25 Version 11c, 1634-26 Version 11c, 1634-27 Version 11c, 1634-28 Version 11c, 1634-29 Version 11c, 1634-30 Version 11c, 1634-31 Version 11c, 1634-32 Version 11c, 1634-33 Version 11c, 1634-34 Version 11c, 1634-35 Version 11c, 1634-36 Version 11c, 1634-37 Version 11c, 1634-38 Version 11c, 1634-39 Version 11c, 1634-40 Version 11c, 1634-41 Version 11c, 1634-42 Version 11c; 20210506 SRE Building Performance Specification and SAP Summary Report - Boston Rd (V1 RevF) prepared by SRE 06/05/2021; Full SAP Calculation Printout prepared by Elmhurst Energy; Environmental Statement prepared by Geoff Beardsley and Partners (UK) LLP dated 04/08/2021
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning

| Notwithstanding details shown on the approved plans, details including samples of the materials and finishes to be used for all external surfaces of the superstructure works shall be in accordance with the approved application 193161CND. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surroundings, in accordance with policies 7B and 7.4 of the Development Management DPD (2013); and policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021).
| The refuse and recycling storage facilities hereby approved shall be implemented and operational before the first occupation of any part of the development, and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason:  In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy SI8 of the London Plan (2021).
| The development hereby permitted shall be completed in accordance with the details of soft landscaping as approved by application ref. 220064CND dated 16.02.2022.

Reason: To ensure the communal amenity space is landscaped to ensure its visual amenity and maximises its potential use for amenity in accordance with policies 1.1(k) and (g) of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), policies 7.4 and 7D of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
| The development hereby permitted shall be completed in accordance with the remediation strategy as approved by application ref. 193243CND dated 19.09.2019.

Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents of the development, in accordance with policy 1.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012), policy SI10 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The development hereby approved shall be completed in accordance with the details of a demolition and site construction method statement and management plan approved by application ref. 193304CND dated 02.09.2019.

Reason: To protect the amenity of local residents, to ensure adequate highway and safety in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 and 3.1 of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012), the National Planning Policy Framework (2018), and policies T3, T4, and T6 of the London Plan (2021).

| Condition removed | Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the Local Planning Authority:
a.	Bedrooms (23.00-07.00 hrs) 30 dB LAeq and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
b.	Living rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 35 dB LAeq.
c.	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
d.	The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to first occupation of each dwelling and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.1 (j) of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012), policy 7A of the Development Management DPD (2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration.

| Details of a parking, deliveries and service management plan shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority, prior to first occupation of the development. This shall include details of deliveries and collections, vehicle tracking, servicing trips (including maintenance), cleaning and waste removal and monitoring and review of operations. The approved details shall be brought into use prior to first occupation the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the life of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the development can be adequately services in the interests of pedestrian and highway safety, in accordance with policies T3 and T6 of the London Plan (2021) and policy 6.13 of the Development Management DPD (2013).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A - I of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended), no extensions, alterations or outbuildings shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of future and neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies 1.1 (g) (h), 1.2 (f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 of the Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and with policies D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021).

| Condition removed | Condition removed | A refuse and recycling management plan including details of collection arrangements shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority prior to first occupation of the development and permanently retained thereafter unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To protect the amenity of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 1.1 (e) of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012) and policy D6 of the London Plan (2021).

| (a)Prior to construction completion and occupation, the permitted development shall implement and maintain, and in the case of energy generation equipment confirm as operational, the approved measures to achieve an overall sitewide reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 39.7% (equating to 11.64 tonnes of CO2 per year) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013. These CO2 savings shall be achieved through energy efficiency measures and the installation and maintenance of dwelling Air Source Heat Pumps.

(b)Prior to the installation of the Air Source Heat Pumps technical details of the units shall be submitted to the Council for approval. The details shall include the exact number of heat pump collectors, the heat pump thermal kilowatt output, heat output pipe diameter(s), parasitic load supply schematics, monthly energy demand profile. The name and contact details of the heat pumps installation contractor(s), and if different, the commissioning electrical or plumbing contractor, should be submitted to the Council prior to installation.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure environmentally sustainable development in accordance with policies SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan (2021), and the relevant guidance notes in the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance 2020, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012.
| In order to implement Ealing Council DPD policy 5.2.3 (post-construction energy equipment monitoring), and key parts of London Plan policy SI2 ("be Seen"), the developer shall:

a)	Make a financial contribution to the Council's provider (Energence Ltd) for the post-construction monitoring of the renewable energy technologies to be incorporated into the development as per the energy and CO2 Condition(s).

b)	Upon final construction of the development the agreed suitable devices for monitoring the efficiency (COP) of the Air Source Heat Pumps shall be installed. The monitored data shall be automatically submitted to the Council at daily intervals for a period of four years from occupation and full operation of the energy equipment. The installation of the monitoring devices and the submission and format of the data shall be carried out in accordance with the Council's approved specifications as indicated in the Automated Energy Monitoring Platform (AEMP) information document. The developer must contact the Council's chosen AEMP supplier (Energence Ltd) on commencement of construction to facilitate the monitoring process.

c)	Upon final completion of the development and prior to occupation, the developer must submit to the Council proof of a contractual arrangement with a certified contractor that provides for the ongoing, commissioning, maintenance, and repair of the renewable/low-carbon energy equipment for a period of four years from the point that the building is occupied and the equipment fully operational.

Reason: To monitor the effectiveness and continued operation of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment in order to confirm compliance with energy policies and establish an in-situ evidence base on the performance of such equipment in accordance with London Plan (2021) policy SI2 ("Be Seen" stage of the energy hierarchy), Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and Development Management DPD policy 5.2, E5.2.3, and Policy 2.5.36 (Best Practice) of the Mayor's Sustainable Design & Construction SPG
